summary: The bill, titled the Protecting Endowments from Our Adversaries Act, amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose an excise tax on certain investments of private colleges and universities. The tax targets specified educational institutions that acquire investments from entities on restricted lists, including those maintained by the Secretary of Commerce and the FCC. The bill defines listed investments, specified educational institutions, and sets effective dates for the tax. Primarily, it aims to prevent educational institutions from investing in entities deemed national security threats.
